comments:
An error dialog appears saying that an virtual machine error occured and recommends to exit the workbench when I press right mouse button in Java Browsing perspective on a Project to show the popup menu. If I choose not to
close the workbench the context menu cannot be shown any more in any perspectives.

This bug always occurs in the newest 3.2M6 version. In earlier versions is not reproducable.

I filed bug 134745 for ICU's abuse of InternalError.
Moving to Platform/UI since the exceptions occurs in Collator.getInstance().

I've found the problem.
This bug is because I use the newest jdk 1.6.0_b78 for running eclipse.
If I run it under jdk1.5.0_06 everything works OK.

Since jdk 1.6 is only an early access version please decide if you want to
investigate some efforts into analyzing the bug.
*** Bug 134486 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I filed http://bugs.icu-project.org/cgi-bin/icu-bugs/incoming?findid=5147
against ICU.
*** Bug 134842 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 135264 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 135656 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 136105 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 136540 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 136868 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 136934 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
I am re-opening this one until we get status or a resolution on the ICU bug Martin logged.  Another option is for Eclipse to roll out of using ICU in this case.
Excellent -- this bug is doing my head in. Hopefully this will get it resolved quicker.
*** Bug 136982 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Olivier tested v3.4.4.1 and verified the fix works with mustang.  Released for tonight's build.
marking resolved
Mike, Kevin - this bug is the reason why we need ICU v3.4.4.1.
Does anyone know what the whole problem was due to in the first place? What made it so incompatible with Mustang?

The problem was a incomplete initialization of a byte array from a data input stream.
This was a bug in ICU. In 6.0b77, the read(byte[]) call was initializing the whole array and therefore no error was raised.
In 6.0b78, the same call initialized only a subpart of the array (the first 8K to be precise) and this is the cause of the failure.
The fix was to replace a d.read(raw); with d.readFully(raw);
Doing this, the raw byte array is fully initialized and it works.
Yup. We definitely, want ICU4J 3.4.4.1
Verified ICU v 3.4.4.1 is in build N20060419-0840
*** Bug 138031 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

(In reply to comment #21)
> Verified ICU v 3.4.4.1 is in build N20060419-0840
> As I had a bug that was marked a duplicate of this, I
can add:

a.  thanks for the quick turn-around from the ICU team;
b.  for the manifestation of this bug that I reported,
last night I took the April 20 binary of Java 1.6 to
combine with the April 19 binary of Eclipse and I can
confirm that the problem no longer occurs when attempting
to search for all references for some method.
